title: Single-Source Regular Path Querying in Terms of Linear Algebra
abstract:
A given edge-labelled graph two-way regular path queries (2-RPQs) allow one
to use regular languages over labelled edges and inverted edges to constraint
paths of interest. 2-RPQs are (partially) adopted in different real-world graph
analysis systems and are a part of the GQL ISO standard. But the performance of
2-RPQs on real-world graphs is still a bottleneck for wider adoption. A new
single-source 2-RPQ algorithm based on linear algebra is proposed. Utilization
of high-performance sparse linear algebra libraries for the algorithm
implementation allows one to achieve significant speedup over competitors on
real-world data and queries. Our implementation demonstrates better performance
on average on Wikidata and the respective query log in comparison with
MillenniumDB, FalkorDB, and the algorithm of Diego Arroyuelo et al.
